post.desc:
Now that I look up what Ky≈çko is actually chanting... basically, it's a catchy closing part of the Heart Sutra. [**Here, if you want to hear what it sounds like.**](https://youtu.be/a4vmA9noFXo&t=1421)

I do wonder how they end up with "gya" and not just "ga" though, given that the original sounds like "gah-teh". ü§î I guess it sounds better when you drag the syllable out in a prayer session? "Gaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa" vs. "Giiiiiiiiiiiiaaaaaaaaaaaa".

By the way, both Yuyuko and Ky≈çko (obviously) say this only to Y≈çmu.
